bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 46 (Thursday, March 14, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. YOUNG:H.R. 1806.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3``The Congress shall have the power to regulate commercewith foreign nations, and among several states, and with theIndian Tribes''[Page H2747]

item.title: Empowering Rural Economies Through Alaska Native Sustainable Arts and Handicrafts Act

latestAction.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Oceans, and Wildlife.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Empowering Rural Economies Through Alaska Native Sustainable Arts and Handicrafts Act

This bill prohibits states from imposing bans on marine mammal and fossilized ivory products produced by Alaska Natives.

Specifically, states may not prohibit (1) the importation, sale, transfer, trade, barter, or possession of mammoth, mastodon, or walrus ivory, marine mammal bones, teeth, or baleen legally produced by an Alaska Native as an authentic native article of handicrafts and clothing; or (2) the importation, sale, transfer, trade, or possession of fossilized ivory.

bill.title: Empowering Rural Economies Through Alaska Native Sustainable Arts and Handicrafts Act

item.title: Empowering Rural Economies Through Alaska Native Sustainable Arts and Handicrafts Act
To amend the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 to protect the cultural practices and livelihoods of producers of Alaska Native handicrafts and fossilized ivory products, and for other purposes.
Empowering Rural Economies Through Alaska Native Sustainable Arts and Handicrafts Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Oceans, and Wildlife.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
